basic.description: Introduction to techniques for specifying the behaviour of software, with applications of these techniques to design, verification and construction of software. Logic-based techniques such as loop invariants and class invariants. Automata and grammar-based techniques, with applications to scanners, parsers, user-interface dialogs and embedded systems. Computability issues in software specifications.
basic.subject: CMPE
basic.title: Software Specifications

extra.enrollment_requirement:
PREREQ: ELEC 270 and ELEC 276 or ELEC 278 and must be registered in BSCE.
EXCLUSION: CISC 366
